# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the Julia code that accomplishes this:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_str, " ")
    wrapped_str = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_str) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_str *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(wrapped_str)
            wrapped_str *= " "
        end
        
        wrapped_str *= word
    end
    
    return wrapped_str
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
input_string = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped because it's too long. It has multiple sentences and punctuation as well."
println(wrap_string(input_string))
```

This will print:

```
This is a long string 
that needs to be wrapped 
because it's too long. 
It has multiple sentences 
and punctuation as well.
```
